Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class ConcurrentBitSet

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.BitSet
com.shouldis.bitset.ConcurrentBitSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class ConcurrentBitSet
extends BitSet
Implementation of BitSet in which all methods capable of reading or writing the state of bits are delegated to concurrent-safe operations.

The use of atomic operations allows concurrent modification of this ConcurrentBitSet without any external synchronization at the cost of some performance. These operations are done by the semantics of VarHandle.setVolatile(Object...). Note that operations affecting more than 1 word such as BitSet.flip() and BitSet.xOr(BitSet), will only be made atomic on a per-word basis.

Some operations can leverage VarHandle better than others -- the following are performed on a perfectly atomic basis:

  • BitSet.get(int)
  • BitSet.set(int)
  • BitSet.clear(int)
  • BitSet.flip(int)
  • getWord(int)
  • setWord(int, long)
  • andWord(int, long)
  • orWord(int, long)
  • xOrWord(int, long)
  • BitSet.flipWord(int)
  • BitSet.fillWord(int)
  • BitSet.emptyWord(int)
The other operations must use CAS operations, and can encounter memory contention as a result. In these cases, all methods will retry the operation until it is successful, but tryApply(int, WordFunction) and tryApply(int, WordBiFunction, long) can instead be used to have control over what happens in the event of memory contention. tryAdd(int) and tryRemove(int) are also defined, but will return false under two separate conditions: either encountering memory contention, or when add(int) or remove(int) would typically return false.
Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
BitSet, Serialized Form

    Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words such that it retains the previous state of bits where the bits of mask are in the dead state, and takes on the value of bits in word where mask has bits in the live state.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public boolean add​(int index)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Ensures that the bit at the specified index is in the live state. If it is not, it will be changed.
      Overrides:
      add in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to change to the live state.
      Returns:
      whether or not this BitSet was changed as a result.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(int index)
      Description copied from class: BitSet

      Overrides:
      remove in class BitSet
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      whether or not this BitSet was changed as a result.

    • tryAdd

      public boolean tryAdd​(int index)
      Tries to set the bit at the specified index to the live state. If it is not already the live state, it will be changed. Unlike add(int), this method will not retry in the event of memory contention, and will instead return false.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to change to the live state.
      Returns:
      whether or not this BitSet was changed as a result.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative, or greater than or equal to BitSet.size.

    • tryRemove

      public boolean tryRemove​(int index)
      Tries to set the bit at the specified index to the dead state. If it is not already in the dead state, it will be changed. Unlike remove(int), this method will not retry in the event of memory contention, and will instead return false.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the bit to change to the dead state.
      Returns:
      whether or not this BitSet was changed as a result.
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative, or greater than or equal to BitSet.size.

      Overrides:
      andWord in class BitSet
      Parameters:

    • notAndWord

      public void notAndWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of a NOT AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] = ~(words[wordIndex] & mask);
      Overrides:
      notAndWord in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the NOT AND operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the NOT AND operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.

      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of a NOT OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      Performs words[wordIndex] = ~(words[wordIndex] | mask);
      Overrides:
      notOrWord in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the NOT OR operation upon.
      mask - the mask to use in the NOT OR operation on the current value at the specified wordIndex.

      Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of a NOT XOR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
      words[wordIndex] = ~(words[wordIndex] ^ mask);
      Overrides:
      notXOrWord in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to perform the NOT XOR operation upon.

    • setWordSegment

      public void setWordSegment​(int wordIndex, long word, long mask)
      Description copied from class: BitSet
      Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words such that it retains the previous state of bits where the bits of mask are in the dead state, and takes on the value of bits in word where mask has bits in the live state.
      Overrides:
      setWordSegment in class BitSet
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to change.
      word - the new long value to be set to BitSet.words.
      mask - the mask used to determine which bits from word will be applied.

    • tryApply

      public boolean tryApply​(int wordIndex, WordFunction function)
      Tries to apply the specified WordFunction function to the word at the specified wordIndex. While apply(int, WordFunction) will retry in the event of memory contention, this method returns a boolean representing whether or not the operation was successful.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to apply the function to.
      function - the WordFunction to apply at the specified wordIndex.
      Returns:
      whether or not the operation was successfully applied, meaning it didn't encounter any memory contention.

    • tryApply

      public boolean tryApply​(int wordIndex, WordBiFunction function, long mask)
      Tries to apply the specified WordBiFunction function to the word at the specified wordIndex. While apply(int, WordBiFunction, long) will retry in the event of memory contention, this method returns a boolean representing whether or not the operation was successful.
      Parameters:
      wordIndex - the index within BitSet.words to apply the function to.
      function - the WordBiFunction to apply at the specified wordIndex in conjunction with mask.
      mask - the mask to use in the specified function.
      Returns:
      whether or not the operation was successfully applied, meaning it didn't encounter any memory contention.
